chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: But Job answered and said,
items.plainText: But Job answered and said,

items.text: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
items.plainText: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

items.text: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
items.plainText: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

items.text: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
items.plainText: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

items.text: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?
items.plainText: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?

items.text: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
items.plainText: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

items.text: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.
items.plainText: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.

items.text: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
items.plainText: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!

items.text: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
items.plainText: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

items.text: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
items.plainText: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

items.text: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
items.plainText: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?

items.text: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?
items.plainText: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?

items.text: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?
items.plainText: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

items.text: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
items.plainText: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.

items.text: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;
items.plainText: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;

items.text: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:
items.plainText: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:

items.text: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
items.plainText: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

items.text: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.
items.plainText: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

items.text: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.
items.plainText: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

items.text: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.
items.plainText: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

items.text: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.
items.plainText: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.

items.text: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?
items.plainText: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

items.text: Or, Deliver me from the enemy's hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?
items.plainText: Or, Deliver me from the enemy's hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

items.text: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
items.plainText: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

items.text: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?
items.plainText: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

items.text: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
items.plainText: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?

items.text: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
items.plainText: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.

items.text: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
items.plainText: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.

items.text: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.
items.plainText: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.

items.text: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
items.plainText: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
